item.name: System Temperature
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlTemperature) Device temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..) Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

discovery_rule.name: UPLINK Interfaces Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovering interfaces from IF-MIB. Interfaces with down(2) Administrative Status are not discovered.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}): Download
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface,including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}): Upload
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} or {Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} and {Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage >{$IF_UTIL_MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template SNMP Fiberhome - OLT:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down

trigger.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger.name: Device: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Device"}
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}
